story.text: The smallest unit of [[modular]] networking. For purposes of designing the human social network, the Node is [[City]], of which there are several sizes.

A TinyCity is a node, and a Polis, which is made up of several TinyCities, is a module of nodes. Likewise, a Polis is also a node, and a Metropolis, which is made up of several Poli, is also a module of nodes.
Like a square and a rectangle, a module is also a node, but a node is not a module.
Self-sufficient human created organism of the network that can be joined together into exponentially (1/4 power)more efficient self-sufficient organism, called module.

In communication networks, a node (Latin nodus, ‘knot’) is either a redistribution point (e.g. data communications equipment), or a communication endpoint (e.g. data terminal equipment). The definition of a node depends on the network and protocol layer referred to. A physical network node is an active electronic device that is attached to a network, and is capable of creating, receiving, or transmitting information over a communications channel. A passive distribution point such as a distribution frame or patch panel is consequently not a node - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Node_(networking) wikipedia]

# See also
* [[Computer network nodes]]
* [[Telecommunication network nodes]]
* [[Distributed system nodes]]
* [[See also]]
* [[References]]

item.text: A module is also a node, but a node is not a module.
Like a square and a rectangle, a module is also a node, but a node is not a module.
A several nodes make up a module.

A TinyCity is a Node, and a Polis, which is made up of several TinyCities, is a module of nodes. Likewise, a Polis is also a node, and a Metropolis, which is made up of several Poli, is also a module of nodes.
Like a square and a rectangle, a module is also a node, but a node is not a module.
